Description: Green glazed composition fragment of amuletic figure in the form of the god Ptah; laterally pierced at the back of the neck for suspension
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but possibly from Tell Dafana, as suggested by the context of the item in the list, if not from Tell Nabasha or any other Eastern Delta site excavated by Petrie in 1886.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.61, p.180, pl.22)
Condition: incomplete - foot section broken away, surface worn
